name: The Ultimate TV Doctors Quiz | Professions on TV

questions.text: Richard Chamberlain, 'king' of TV mini-series, played this title doctor in a regular TV series (1961-66):
questions.explanation:
Dr. Kildare

	He was quite the heartthrob.

questions.text: Which doctor replaced Dr. Crusher for the second season of 'Star Trek: The Next Generation'?
questions.explanation:
Dr. Kate Pulaski

	All these doctors were played by Diana Muldaur! Dr. Thompkins was from Batman: The Animated Series. Drs. Mulhall and Jones were guest characters on 'Star Trek' (the original series).

questions.text: Which of the following characters is NOT a doctor on 'ER'?
questions.explanation:
Jeanie Boulet.

	Jeanie (Gloria Reuben) is a Physicians Assistant (PA).

questions.text: Who plays the EMH (Emergency Medical Hologram) on 'Star Trek: Voyager'?
questions.explanation:
Robert Picardo.

	McNeill and Betran play Paris and Chakotay on 'Voyager'. Conrad played James West on 'The Wild, Wild West'.

questions.text: Brady Bunch, ep 'Is There a Doctor in the House?': Dr. Porter, a woman, was the girls' doctor; Dr. Cameron, a man, was the boys' doctor. Name one of the actors that played these doctors:
questions.explanation:
Marion Ross & Herbert Anderson.

	Marion Ross played Mrs. Marion Cunningham on 'Happy Days'. Herbert Anderson played Henry Mitchell on 'Dennis the Menace'.

questions.text: Who was Dr. Marcus Welby's assistant?
questions.explanation:
Dr. Steven Kiley

	Played by James Brolin.

questions.text: Who was the doctor on 'Battlestar Galactica' (1978 series)?
questions.explanation:
Dr. Salik

	Played by George Murdock. The other 3 characters were Vulcans on various 'Star Trek' productions, Selar being the only physician.

questions.text: On 'Jesse', he was the young doctor that worked in the clinic where Jesse was doing her nurse internship:
questions.explanation:
Dr. Kozak

	Played by Kevin Rahm. (Dr. Kovac is on 'ER'.)

questions.text: What type of doctor was Dr. Cliff Huxtable on 'The Cosby Show'?
questions.explanation:
Obstetrics and gynaecology - OBGYN.

	Played by Bill Cosby.

questions.text: Dr. Frasier Crane and his brother Dr. Niles Crane practice this specialty:
questions.explanation:
psychiatry.

	Played by Kelsey Grammer and David Hyde Pierce.

questions.text: St. Elsewhere: which doctor was not properly accredited to practice medicine?
questions.explanation:
Dr. Morrison

	Dr. Jack Morrison (David Morse) attended a Central American medical school. He revealed this non-chalantly, not knowing that his education was not accredited in the US. He was 'demoted' until he could graduate American medical school.

questions.text: A medical doctorate was just one of many doctoral degrees that this time-traveller had on 'Quantum Leap':
'The Fugitive' was a 1993 blockbuster movie starring Harrison Ford, playing Dr. Richard Kimble. Who played Dr. Kimble in the 1963 TV show that the movie was based upon?
She played Dr. Helena Russell on 'Space: 1999':
On 'Law and Order', this actress has played Dr. Elizabeth Olivet since 1991:
questions.explanation:
Carolyn McCormick.

	Catherine Hicks played Dr. Taylor in the movie 'Star Trek IV'. Michelle Forbes played Dr. Cox, the coroner, on 'Homicide: Life on the Street'. I made up Carolyn Hardcastle. (Get it? Hardcastle? McCormick? *sigh*)
